[GRAMMAR]: Some sentences are overly long and convoluted
[LEXICON]: A few words are used in ways that may be unfamiliar to modern readers

[STRUCTURE]: The narrative jumps abruptly from the present scene to Kuei Ping's memory of her graduation day
[TRANSITION]: Some transitions between ideas and scenes feel a bit disjointed
[CLARITY]: A few sections are dense and require close attention to follow

[SPELLING]: minor spelling errors (e.g. "la France" instead of "la France" is correct, but "have" instead of "has" in "Madame Yen have told her granddaughter")
[SYNTAX]: awkward sentence structure in some places

[LOGIC]: abrupt transition between Kuei Ping's thoughts and the conversation with Madame Yen
[STRUCTURE]: non-linear narrative that may confuse some readers
[CLARITY]: some sentences are wordy or unclear
